_header: My woeful heart in painful weariness
Subjects: women, as speakers/narrators; love, rewards of
_description: A love poem signed ‘Sheryngam’ — one stanza rhyme royal

BLAdd5465.First Lines:
My wofull hart in paynfull werynessWhich hath byn long plungyng
                    with thought unseyne…
BLAdd5465.Last Lines:
…That I am bownde above all erthly thyngTo ove and dred hym as
                    my lord and kyng
BLAdd5465.Note: With music in two voices credited to Sheryngham.
